hours_text:
## Visit

In 1986, the artist Donald Judd (1928–1994) established The Chinati Foundation/La Fundación Chinati in Marfa, Texas, as a site for the permanent installation of large-scale works of art. It was Judd’s goal to bring art, architecture, and land together to form a coherent whole, and for a select group of artists to present work according to their own intentions.

As an artist-created and artist-centered foundation, Chinati’s mission is to care for its collection and present it to a broad public; to build community and support artists through public programs, artist residencies, educational activities, and exhibitions; and to steward the architecture and the land that Judd conceived as integral to Chinati.

[Guided tours](https://chinati.org/visit-chinati/tours/) are the only way to see the majority of Chinati’s Collection. Currently, Chinati offers three types of guided tours daily: the full collection tour, selections tour, and focus tours. Tours are by reservation only. Complimentary access to Donald Judd’s 15 untitled works in concrete is available Wednesday through Sunday, from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., with last admittance at 4 p.m.

Hours and guided tour times are seasonal. See our [hours & locations page](https://chinati.org/hours-locations/) and [reservation calendar](https://ci.ovationtix.com/32515) for up-to-date information.

[Guided tours](https://chinati.org/visit-chinati/tours/) are free for Chinati [members](https://chinati.org/support/become-a-member/), childr...
